dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better hurry it up, Doc. My shift's almost over. Josh hands him a piece of paper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess someone requested you for overtime...buddy. Peter braces his legs and tries to push the whole bank of lockers clear--the locker section tips and falls with an ENORMOUS BANG, which echoes loudly off the tile walls. Du flies everywhere. When the dust settles and flashlights are focussed on the area of the wall where the lockers stood, we see a LARGE HOLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Using a steel probe, Susan examines the dead insect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Posterior sternites are gone...half the protonum rotted off. Raymond lifts one of the wings.  A CLUMP OF WHITE LARVAE feasts on the flesh underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggots...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Near hatching.  Thing must've died about three weeks ago. Susan closes the mandibles and examines them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have a polaroid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water DRIPPING from overhead, ECHOING footsteps- very spooky.  Leonard leads Peter and Josh down the tunnel-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all watch your step.  We got some burrows goin' down seven stories here.  You fall, I don't wanna have to come pick you up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whisper to Peter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: New York's finest. Monumental archways give way to naves as big as Notre Dam Josh flashes the ultra-violet light over an abandoned underground encampment, made of cardboard walls, electric wiring, elaborate debris kitchens. The walls are complete taken by layer after layer of hand carved initials and messages. Everything from "Kilroy was here" to elaborate quotations from the bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's really people living down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mole people. This section was pretty popular, all the way to Fulton Street... Their flashlights shine in a haze of brown dust. The air heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Substance abusers, mental cases... Then about a year ago, Poof! All gone. Rumors got started... Someone found a couple of stiffs... They work their way down a steep incline. They're covered sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down here's the land of talk, see? So the wildest version goes the farthest. They mark that area with a sign or a drawing, and its as good as closed. (chuckles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had one fella... for years said he was Bela Lugosi. Got him on Geraldo. Peter's cellular rings. He picks up -big static-

dialogues.speaker: MORGUE
dialogues.text: Susan's got the phone up on her shoulder, clamped against ear. Raymond's cranking out a bunch of Polaroids. Color s of the insect, from every angle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me. Can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (phone, barely audible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, barely. We haven't found anything down here. Nothing... Jeremy goes to the fridge for a beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have. The fridge light plays over the large insects jaws. It ma out a few new ridges and valleys. Raymond snaps a couple Polaroids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on my way. I've got something for you to look at... Susan notices something weird and undefinable about the contours of the claws... But she can't put her finger on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be back at the platform in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 minutes. If you don't go sight-seeing anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To phone.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 minutes. (Beat.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan? The call is lost. Peter tries to change frequencies, but useless. Peter replaces the phone in his pocket.  He walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny.  Shoulda seen some track bunnies by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Track bunnies.  Rats.  They're usually around. No one notices the OVERCOAT MAN carving on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On Manny's dining room table, a heap of unpolished shoes accumulated. The radio is playing a sad, elegiac Tango.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, please understand... I can't wait that long. Looking disheveled and tired, Manny clutches the phone, listening intently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. I write it down. (he writes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2... 8... 7... 3. What does this mean "case number"? Okay. So, now what?  When can you...? He holds a color snapshot of Chuy sitting on a mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't wait...no, listen... Click. Manny slowly hangs up. He stares at his notepad, a the number 2873.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hijos de puta. He crumples it up, throws it away, crosses to the window, picks up Chuy's last wire figure-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another human-looking figure, long and thin, but with something slightly off about it. It has six limbs instead of four!

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: frowns, looks down at the dark flophouse across the stree

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Funny Shoes. Distant thunder is heard.

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM CABINET
dialogues.text: Manny takes a STRAIGHT RAZOR from the bathroom cabinet, o the blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan arrives at the stairs leading down to the subway station. A COUPLE passes her on their way up. A sign over the entrance says "STATION WILL CLOSE FOR REP AT 3 PM - TOKENS ONLY". Susan looks around- the area is s deserted, a bit creepy. She takes a deep breath, descends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan pushes through the turnstile, enters the long corri of gleaming tile, a somewhat de-humanizing atmosphere, straight out of a George Tooker painting. Very creepy.  Susan's footsteps ECHO in the empty tunnel. She sneaks a nervous glance over her shoulder- nobody is following her-

dialogues.speaker: PLATFORM "A" DELANCEY
dialogues.text: Susan observes the locker room door impatiently. A small of REPAIRMEN are dismantling a row of fluorescent lights. She sits and waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, Josh and Leonard walk through a darker area. The floor beneath them suddenly changes, becomes tile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Sniffing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells like acid. Peter stops, looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ammonia. Josh walks to the right, where the smell seems to emanate from.  At last they come to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josh LIGHTS a flare, sets it on the ground, walks ahead. ominous RUMBLE of a subway is heard in the distance. A cracked WATER MAIN above.  Water dribbles to the ground

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some weird shit here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weird shit...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look. Leonard shines his flashlight ahead. Revealed, quite literally, is a world of shit. LARGE FECES scattered everywhere:  on the floor, hanging sausage-like from the ceiling.  One can almost taste the stench of old ammonia. Peter puts on a rubber glove, inspects one of the fecal stalactites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fecal matter, unknown origin: weird shit. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, it's not human. Josh breaks off a sample, drops it in a jar with a hard THUNK.  Leonard turns away in distaste.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it needs some metamucil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's raining like hell. Manny approaches the abandoned flophouse. He peeks through the boarded-up front entrance. Right the on the dusty lobby floor, clearer than the larger shoeprints... ...he discovers a trail of tiny, barefoot prints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuy... He kicks experimentally at the planks, but they're far to strong.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEY
dialogues.text: Manny explores the opposite face of the building, looking a way in. A DOG is BARKING incessantly. Manny turns. Something moves in the shadows!  Something long and thin, haloed  by the rain. It moves again, the streetlight touching it for a fleetin moment as it totters around to the rear of the building. It's The Overcoat Man! The man hurries past. Manny sprints after him.

dialogues.speaker: ALLEYS
dialogues.text: Manny comes running around a pile of grocery crates. There is the OVERCOAT MAN. CARGO WORKERS mill around a group of vegetable trucks, unloading produce. The OVERCOAT MAN attracts no attention. Keeping his head down, staying near the shadowed buildings. Jumping and hopping, he skitters into an alley.

dialogues.speaker: FOLLOWING
dialogues.text: Manny has to trot to keep up with the mysterious figure. pauses to take a pill and place it under his tongue. Once it takes effect he moves on. The OVERCOAT MAN has moved past a chainlink fence. How?? It's too high!!! The old man squeezes through a jagged opening. The metal fabric cuts his shirt. On the other side: a dead end. Nowhere to go except for...

dialogues.speaker: A SEWAGE GRATE
dialogues.text: Manny lifts it.

dialogues.speaker: SEWAGE PIPE
dialogues.text: Manny lands on his feet with considerable difficulty. He flicks his lighter flame and opens the straight razor. This pipe is carpeted with trash and a thick crust of dir Something moves under a wet newspaper: a thick mass of lo legged spiders dissolve onto the walls and floor. Suddenly...the distant sound of spoons playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuy... Manny pulls a rosary from his pocket, wraps it around his wrist and crosses himself with the razor... ...then begins to move down the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: PLATFORM "A" DELANCEY
dialogues.text: Susan examines the Polaroids.  She pulls out a payday bar The crew of repairmen are leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Lady, all power will be down in five minutes, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.... She munches on the bar. She stops: one snapshot has caugh her attention.  The fridge light illuminated this photogr Susan turns it around... and around... Trying to find something different in the lines. A train roars by. Then she notices it:

dialogues.speaker: THE POLAROID
dialogues.text: The closed jaws. They look like A HUMAN FACE.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Gets up nervously and heads for the dor to the locker roo A whole row of lamps goes off. The rest flickers in and out. Then we see, now standing on her platform: THE OVERCOAT M He looks at her between a row of columns under the dead n lights. Susan tries the locker room door. It's unlocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: carefully crosses the floor to the bank of lockers. She kneels to examine the hole in the wall.  She nears a noise. THE OVERCOAT MAN is moving toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter?

dialogues.speaker: OVERCOAT MAN
dialogues.text: The man's face TIPS BACK... ...raising the complex, glittering INSECT HEAD FROM BEHIN ITS MASK-LIKE FRONT JAWS. Its multi-parted MOUTH clicks OPEN. Susan SCREAMS! The thing charges, its "coat" opening to reveal...SIX LEATHERY WINGS, fully extended! The wingspan blocks the whole tunnel, they vibrate rapidly. Susan tries to run, but the creature -- hereafter known simply as "The Mimic" -- LEAPS ONTO HER CHEST! She's dragged screaming into the hole. Their silhouettes recede rapidly amidst a confusion of le wings and pipes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Josh put the fecal samples into the back-pack. Leonard stands at the other end of the area. He inspects OLD SCAFFOLDING set up at an opening which leads to

dialogues.speaker: THE REMAINS OF AN OLD STATION
dialogues.text: fifteen feet below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never been this deep. This area here is the Old Armory station. They built it in the 40's. Ran out of money half-way through... It's like Grand Central's dead little brother. Tiled mosa walls, columns, monumental arches. Spaces for shops. A gr of abandoned turn-of-the-century subway cars on parallel tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, the fat lady's singing. Time to go. Everything is gray with dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Josh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a team in here by six tonight, hands and knees with toothpicks... Leonard squints down at the planks of the scaffolding. A NYMPH -- big as the one seen earlier -- emerges from a of nearby feces as if it were part of the mound. Keeping his eyes fixed on the insect, Leonard coolly bend down, picks up a ROCK.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: putting the last sample boxes into the back-pack, looks u and sees

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: step onto the scaffolding, raising the rock to crush the nymph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't!! SMASH! Leonard tosses the rock at the insect, crushing it Peter rushes to the insect's corpse on the scaffolding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see the size of that thing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look what you did! You stupid sonofa- A CREAK from the scaffolding at their combined weight. Leonard grabs Peter, tries to pull him from the scaffoldi

dialogues.speaker: THE ENTIRE SCAFFOLDING GIVES WAY
dialogues.text: Buckling diagonally... ...taking Peter and Leonard with it... CRASH!  Both Peter and Leonard are thrown to the ground o the station below.  The scaffolding falls around them.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: rushes forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter!

dialogues.speaker: PETER AND LEONARD
dialogues.text: stir in the wreckage.  Peter rises shakily.  He puts his glasses on. One of the lenses is badly smashed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay.  I'm all right. He tries to help Leonard up; Leonard knocks his hand away

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell away from me! Peter looks up at Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Deadpan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's all right, too. Leonard brushes himself off, checks out his walkie-talkie It's been broken in the fall, a tangle of plastic and wir He curses under his breath. Peter checks the wall for a handhold.  But there's only smooth tile and dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's gonna work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a better way up? Leonard removes his badge, tosses it up to Josh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Josh.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show that to the station manager.  Tell him Leonard's gonna have his bubble-butt he don't have someone down here in ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H-how do I get...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Way we came.  Take the first tunnel to your right... Leonard's voice echoes off the cavernous walls. Josh hurriedly writes it down in his notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go left.  Go left again till you hit the fork... Then right again. You got that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so. One right, two lefts...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go Josh. Now. Josh obeys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear a persistent BEEPING... A concrete ROOM filled with glimmering debris. Cans, eyeglasses, fake teeth, chrome, foil, glass shards, broke watches. Susan lies unconscious, half-sunk in a mulch of decomposi food, old newspapers, plastic garbage bags.  An inch of b WATER burbles past her bloody head. SOMETHING jostles her, rocking her back and forth. Her eyelids slowly open.

dialogues.speaker: A HUGE MIMIC IS PERCHED ON HER BODY
dialogues.text: Its WINGCASE is drooped around her like a shroud. The creature furiously tears at her jacket, trying to get at Susan's beeper. The beeper spills from her pocket along with several Pay bars.  The Mimic CRUSHES the machine instantly, then chom up all the candy bars with a single move of its mandibles Susan watches in terror as the creature steps away. A SOUND from an adjacent tunnel.  Susan looks... ...and sees ANOTHER MIMIC pulling the REMAINS OF A MAN in the darkness. Susan gropes around her in the soggy debris, looking for weapon.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN'S HAND
dialogues.text: Her fingers close around a three-foot piece of RUSTY PIPE Something dark drips on her hand.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: looks up. Above her, a badly decomposing HUMAN FOOT, or w is left of it.  All part of the excarnated corpse of the Chinese Preacher.  His gold cross shines boldly in the da Susan GASPS.

dialogues.speaker: THE MIMIC
dialogues.text: hears the sound.  It immediately SKITTERS back to her.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: jerks herself sideways... AND STABS THE PIPE into the Mimic's thorax with a wet CRR Susan heaves herself up, pushing the thing onto its back. The Mimic BUZZES furiously, milky WHITE FOAM pumping from wound.  Its legs slash the air as it tries to right itsel Susan runs for the tunnels, debris falling from her cloth

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: comes to a t-junction.  He checks his notepad for the appropriate direction. He turns, heads left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan staggers through a dark PASSAGEWAY.  Water drizzles into her grimy face.  She looks up. Rain leaks from an overhead grate three stories up.  She see the SHOES of PEOPLE walking to and fro above.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life as usual on Delancey street. Pedestrians crisscross the metal grate, hunched under the umbrellas.  Traffic noise, T.V. displays on street front stores, boom boxes, car horns... They drown out the tiny sound of Susan's voice...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: hears distant FEET SCURRYING toward her, punctuated by a metallic CLANG!  CLANG!  CLANG!

dialogues.speaker: SIDE TUNNEL
dialogues.text: CLANG!  The metal pipe, still imbedded in the Mimic, BANG the wall as the insect moves down the dripping narrow tun

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: looks around frantically.  She crosses to a METAL LID on floor, lifts it. A HOLE is below, dropping off into darkness. The Mimic's CLANGING grows louder. Susan sits herself on the edge of the hole, grasping the metal lid by handles on its underside. The Mimic rushes into the chamber, speeding toward her... Susan JUMPS into the hole, hanging onto the lid... WHANG!  The lid SLAMS SHUT over the hole a fraction of a second before the creature reaches it. The Mimic touches the lid with its antennae, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TICK-TICKING of the Mimic's antennae scanning the lid Susan hangs from the handles on the lid, her arms trembli Susan's strength gives out.  She lets go, falls.

dialogues.speaker: PIPE GALLERY
dialogues.text: Susan CRASHES onto a juncture between two large PIPES. She MOANS in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: secures her position, looks down.  A seemingly bottomless below, crisscrossed with a FOREST OF PIPES AND DUCTS. The nearest pipe above her is well beyond reach. She is trapped. Then she hears the SOUND of the LID OPENING above.  She h her breath. A faint YELLOW LIGHT of a lighter flickers down at her.

dialogues.speaker: WET SECTION
dialogues.text: Josh cautiously enters a vaulted area.  Old pipes have be ripped from the walls.  WATER gushes over the steel-plate walls.  He looks around- this doesn't seem familiar. Josh freezes as he sees something behind a loose metal PL on the wall. He yanks at the plate- it gives a little bit. He yanks harder- the plate falls down on one side, hanging precariously from a loose bolt. It reveals A HOLE PACKED WITH DOZENS AND DOZENS OF OOTHEC He leans close to examine them- there is a NOISE in the tunnel behind him-

dialogues.speaker: WATERFALL
dialogues.text: A curtain of WATER falls over the side of a pipe onto the floor.  Behind it, something ENORMOUS crawls into view. Multiple legs, antennae, an elongated body distorted by t water and the light of a flare.  It stops-

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: Holding his breath and tiptoeing sideways, never taking h eyes off the thing, Josh begins to move away.  He sees a narrow OPENING in the wall- there seems to be dim LIGHT coming from something beyond it.  He tries to squeeze thr the opening-

dialogues.speaker: MIMIC
dialogues.text: The creature is immobile behind the sheet of water, as if mesmerized by its flow-

dialogues.speaker: PIT
dialogues.text: With tremendous effort, Josh passes through the opening. He finds himself inside a bowl-shaped mud hole.  Scattere around him he sees FUNNY BUNNY PATCHES that were sewn in sweatshop.  He trips on a half-buried SEWING MACHINE.  He looks up- Above him is a grate.  He's come to the SHOWER ROOM of th sweatshop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty now, except for the rusting sewing machines in a corner.  We TILT to see Josh moving the grate away.  He jumps- no way he can grab onto the slippery tile-

dialogues.speaker: PIT
dialogues.text: Josh puts the old sewing machine upright.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: Suddenly, the bolt hinging the plate gives way and... the steel plate hits the ground: KLANGG!!

dialogues.speaker: THE MIMIC
dialogues.text: leaps into action!

dialogues.speaker: PIT
dialogues.text: hears the CLICKING, fairly close.  He shines his light ba down the hole he entered through-

dialogues.speaker: THE MIMIC
dialogues.text: moves past the waterfall and takes the wall at full speed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit, oh shit, oh shit! He stands on top of the sewing machine, wobbling, reaches the floor above-

dialogues.speaker: SWEATSHOP SHOWER ROOM
dialogues.text: Josh's head and one shoulder are in through the hole.  Hi arms tremble. He makes a desperate lunge and manages to g the POWER CORD of one of the abandoned sewing machines.

dialogues.speaker: THE MIMIC
dialogues.text: rushes through the opening without even slowing down.

dialogues.speaker: JOSH
dialogues.text: pulls himself up, up-  WHAM!  The Mimic hits the lower pa of his body, BLOOD spraying up through the hole.  He SCRE grasps the cord with both hands! He is brutally YANKED down into the hole, the sewing mach tipping, then dragged across the tiled floor till it wedg violently in the hole! We track over to reveal, one of Chuy's perfectly executed WIRE SCULPTURES. Sitting atop another sewing machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ring of FLARES burns in the darkness like an island.  P lights another one, revealing a space buried in layers of dust and time. Cracked MANNEQUIN FACES stares out from an unopened TAILO SHOP.  A FLOWER PARLOR decorated with cobwebs.  A yellowe NEWSPAPER on the floor, its headlines reading:  GERMAN TR DRIVEN BACK ACROSS RHINE. Peter looks up to see Leonard approaching from the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any luck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...there's an old service elevator half a mile down the tracks.  Ain't gonna be much use, though.  Lines are dead. Peter shines his flare up at a thick cord of cables which ominously with electricity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said those cables're still live. Can't we rewire...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man, there you go again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those things bring juice to the new stations.  You just can't rewire that shit... Peter approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For Chrissakes, what's the problem? You need a memo every time you fart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, motherfucker, that's it. He pushes Peter violently. Their eyes lock and meet. Inches away from a fistfight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh! Shh! A SOUND rushing towards them, its echoes increasing by th second. Where is it coming from? Peter looks at Leonard.  Leonard unbuttons his holster cl places his hand on his .22 A SHADOW appears outside the archway. It steps onto the platform. Leonard frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tentative)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny?! The old man stumbles out of the darkness, out of breath. rusted crowbar in his hand. Leonard walks over to him solicitously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, what the hell are you...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, the woman needs help! A shadow crosses Peter's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OUTSTRETCHED HANDS in the darkness. REVEAL Peter leaning across the void with one hand while Manny and Leonard grip his other. Susan below, balancing precariously on the crisscrossing pipes. A mess, but still alive.  She reaches up to Peter. It's too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (A whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me:  we're getting you out. Leonard and Manny pull Peter back into

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter undoes his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Manny and Leonard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your belts. They obey. Peter buckles them together with his. He then loops one end around a bannister, the other around his wr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Manny, as he ties them together)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuy. He was taken. He's down here somewhere... (to Peter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please, hurry. I saw what was after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just hurry. Peter takes his word for it.  He uses the belts to lower himself to the nearest pipe. Leonard LIGHTS a flare to illuminate the pipe gallery. Peter works his way down. The web of pipes seem to recede into Hades. The lifeline tightens. Peter gets to the last solid footing, lies down on his stomach and lets the belts down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming, Sus, I'm coming. But then, he sees something move below her. Then a hollow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Jesus, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Leonard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toss the flare down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only got...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it! Leonard lets the flare drop from his hand. It falls past them, ricocheting off the maze of pipes, spinning down to the pitch-black below. And for a split second the flame illuminates...

dialogues.speaker: THE MIMIC
dialogues.text: pipe in its thorax, nimbly CLIMBING THE PIPES TOWARD SUSA

dialogues.speaker: PETER'S
dialogues.text: eyes grow huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: just plain loses it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is that?! What the fuck is that?!

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: knows all too well what's coming for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (A desperate appeal)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter... Throwing caution to the wind, Peter reaches the belt down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrap it around your hand! Susan at last gets a grip.  Peter pulls with both arms. CLANG! CLANG! CLANG! Getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Susan struggles for footholds on the slippery pipes, ascending foot by foot... Peter pulls her into his arms.

dialogues.speaker: CLANG
dialogues.text: Peter bends down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get on my shoulders! Susan steps onto his shoulders.  He pushes her up... And Leonard and Manny yank her out.

dialogues.speaker: CLANG
dialogues.text: Peter scrambles up, SLAMS the lid back on the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go! The four of them run. HOLD ON the lid. WHAM! It bursts from the floor, rolls away like a coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four humans run down the empty platform.  Peter spare look back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, shit... Far down the tunnel,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There! He points to the open DOOR of an ancient SUBWAY CAR. They sprint for the car, get to the door.  Manny, Peter, Leonard, then Susan...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...tumble inside a repair car crammed with shelves and em crates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the goddam door! Leonard and Peter both grab its handle, slide it shut... SPLACK!  The Mimic crashes into it! KLANGGG!  The door bulges out from the impact, almost tearing itself off the hinges. Susan jumps back.  Manny runs to cover her. The creature is caught, half in, half out, antennae and forelegs waving wildly! The abdomen CRASHES through a pane of glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push it! Push it! Don't let up! Leonard and Peter push harder, barely keeping it pinned. THE UPPER HALF OF THE MIMIC TEARS ITSELF LOOSE. WHITE BLOOD SPATTERS everywhere. The Mimic is NOW CUT IN

dialogues.speaker: HALF
dialogues.text: The wings flap wildly, the abdomen shatters the safety window's outer panels. But the FRONT SECTION IS STILL ALIVE.  It scrabbles in, spraying white blood... ...drags itself up on the ceiling, then down onto the flo and under a row of shelves in a half-circle around the ca till it finally comes to a halt. Silence.  The only sound is a SKITTERING outside. Susan looks outside the window. The Mimic's REAR HALF IS STILL TRYING TO PUSH THROUGH THE DOOR, its feet blindly dragging along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck was that? Peter says nothing. Leonard grabs him by the shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better tell me what the hell's going on here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey!! Take it easy!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Leonard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't know!! We don't know what it is! Leonard releases Peter and, cocking his gun moves closer to the still thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, wait a minute. I'm going to- SNAP!  The Mimic POUNCES on him, catching his leg in its front mandibles. A sickening CRUNCH as the Mimic's mouth begins to work th leg like a grinder-blender.

dialogues.speaker: GET IT
dialogues.text: Peter and Manny try to pull the thing off as Leonard fall and writhes on the floor. BAM! BAM! BAM! The men flinch away as Leonard empties his guns on it, until the thing's shell finally CRACKS! But the thing is still locked onto Leonard's leg.  Peter tries to work it free from the creature's jaws. No good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Its muscles are locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Hoarse)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait... Manny removes a can of shoe polish from his coat, then st smearing the stuff onto the Mimic's head and jaws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus! It's hitting the bone man, get it off!! He lights a CIGARETTE LIGHTER, goes to touch the flame to flammable stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Stopping him.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey hey hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is how we make loose the ticks back home. Peter hesitates, but lets him go.  Manny lights the polis WHOOSH...the Mimic's head is engulfed in a halo of flame. LEGS LOOSEN THEIR GRIP. Peter and Manny yank it free from Leonard, who's PASSED O from the pain.  His leg is torn and bloody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now see the car is 50's vintage.  A POSTER of Mickey Mantle above an empty worktable. Peter sits before Susan.  She's trembling, understandably shaken from her previous experience.  BLOOD pours from a on her forehead. Peter takes a bit of torn cloth, puts it to the wound, th tenderly raises her hand to keep the bandage in place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep holding it.  Can you do that for me? (No reponse.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan? Susan nods silently.  Her hand weakly presses the compres

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doctor Tyler? He turns to Manny, who sits solicitously next to Leonard. His wound is wrapped with makeshift bandages. He begins t stir. Peter gets up, but Susan's hand is closed tightly around like the jaws of the Mimic.  He kisses her gently, then slowly manages to release his hand. He walks to Leonard, inspects his wound. Touches the sole his foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I feel like ripping your fucking eyes out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard, listen.  I need to see if there's any nerve damage before we carry you back. (No response.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm trying to help you here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you helped me here, all right, white boy.  You and your goddam memo. You needed to prove your point, uh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  But I don't think letting you bleed to death is the best apology. Peter touches his foot again. Leonard finally nods. Manny gazes at the Mimic carcass at the end of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell'd that thing come from? Peter looks at Susan.  She remains silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mistake"?  What's that supposed to...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't matter, all right?  It's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you know that?  Shit, it was runnin' around with its buttside gone and a fucking pipe through its heart...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't have a heart. Peter looks up at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just inner chambers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it look like a man. It... I saw it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... She gets up, finally moving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what it wanted you to see.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE CAR
dialogues.text: The subway car sits at the end of the platform, windows d glowing in the dark. The door opens, and Manny and Peter snatch the lower half and wing pieces back into the car.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE CAR
dialogues.text: The lower half of the insect has been moved into the car. Susan is reassembling it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you're saying this is like those bugs that -- that look like twigs or leaves or...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's camouflage... Susan displays the partly-charred head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is mimicry. They evolve to mimic their predators. A butterfly can look like the eyes of an owl.  A catterpillar can copy a snake... Susan closes the multiple mouth parts into a self-contain bud shape, then pushes back the "face" mandibles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has evolved to mimic the most dangerous predator it's ever had... She holds it in her hand, like Yorick's skull. The mimic' head obscenely mirrors her own. She inserts it into the shoulder cavity. She stands back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Us. CAMERA cranes up and reveals that the thing now looks lik THE OVERCOAT MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mantids can mimic. We gave the Judas that code...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quotes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...and behold he will come that walks as a man, yet is not a man- ..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This, is our baby Peter. Yours and mine. Aren't you proud?

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE OF THE CAR
dialogues.text: We see four shadows move fast, scuttling on the walls and ceiling... ...heading towards the car...

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: A SUBWAY MAP on the wall.  Red, blue, and orange lines branching through the boroughs like veins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All these...they're like tunnels of an insect colony. Once these things hit a certain population density, they'll have to move out, form new colonies. The realization hits the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to get help down here.  Burn the tunnels before... She's interrupted by a CLICKING from the tunnel ahead. It's answered by CLICKING from the tunnel behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the doors! A brief glimpse down the car shows too many OTHER DOORS t close in time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there a switch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third rail is dead. (To Manny and Susan.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me up.  There must be a manual override in the booth. Manny and Susan help Leonard up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering to Peter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights! Peter turns off the flashlights. Susan and Manny help Leonard to the car's CONTROL BOOTH. Peter looks

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: where the silhouette of a MIMIC moves to the rear of the

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL BOOTH
dialogues.text: Leonard opens a box on the side-wall marked MANUAL OVERRI Inside, there is a large, HEXAGONAL SHAPED HOLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Starts looking around)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the damn crank?!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: The Mimic is only yards away. OTHER SHADOWS emerge from the distant dark.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: Manny leaves Leonard and Susan to look for the lever cran He runs to help Peter try and shut the doors manually. But it's useless.  Many of the doors won't budge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hissing a whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: The shadows get nearer, their CLICKING louder...

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL BOOTH
dialogues.text: Susan looks under the dashboard, finds a HEXAGONAL SHAPED ROD.  The lever crank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it! Susan gives it to Leonard. He JAMS the rod into the hexag shaped hole.  Perfect fit. Leonard begins CRANKING the thing.  But it's rusty and slow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry! Please!

dialogues.speaker: THROUGHOUT SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: The doors begin to swing shut very slowly.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: sees the moving doors, starts heading for them.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL BOOTH
dialogues.text: Leonard can't crank fast enough.  Susan joins in, putting hands over Leonard's.  Both spin the thing as fast as possible.

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: Peter and Manny each pulling on a door, trying to speed u the closing process. SHADOWS are seen approaching, now very close.

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL BOOTH
dialogues.text: Leonard and Susan put all their effort into turning the c one more time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, you son-of-a...

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: A SOFT CLICK as the doors SHUT IN UNISON. Silence. All four are stock still, like a submarine crew awaiting blast of depth charges.  Their eyes dart to the

dialogues.speaker: WINDOWS
dialogues.text: caked with soot, irradiated by the distant glow of one of red flares. THUCK! Something BUMPS against the door. A machine-gun patter of FOOTSTEPS on the roof. The car SHAKES.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: The dark platform is alive with phantom shapes.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE
dialogues.text: SCREEECH!! Something sharp is drawn along the car roof li nail over a chalkboard. THUMP! THUMP!  Impacts on the sides... An obscene symphony of sounds as Mimics lay siege to the

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: A BUZZ OF WINGS catches his attention.  He turns.  His fa is reflected in a security window. CRACK!  The window SPLINTERS, destroying Peter's reflecti

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE MANNY
dialogues.text: Claws SCRATCH the ceiling. It begins to dent.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW SUSAN AND LEONARD
dialogues.text: Large forms CLICKING underneath, looking for a way in. Susan stares at the floor, her eyes following the course the clicking... ...which leads to Leonard's wounded, bloodstained leg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God. (Looks at Leonard.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood... KLANGGG!  A Mimic leg PIERCES the ceiling above them! Susan pulls Leonard out of the way just in time as

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: KLANG!  KLANG! More legs break through the ceiling!

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN AND LEONARD
dialogues.text: emerge from the control booth, Leonard's arm over Susan's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His blood! It's driving them crazy! We have to mask the odor!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?! But there's not time enough to discuss possible solutions Leonard pulls off his jacket. Susan begins wrapping it ar his wound to mask it. Manny helps. Peter has upended one shelf, jamming it against a broken window as a barricade. Despite their efforts, the Mimics are not thrown off the scent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's no use! They know we're in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't know anything Peter, they just sense. They're hardwired!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Hardwired to eat anything that's not like them! The whole car is now shaking and buckling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exac... She looks over at the severed Mimic corpse nearby.  A realization...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Manny)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your razor. Manny looks at her blankly. Susan just takes the blade. The whole car is now shaking and buckling. She runs to the Mimic's carcass.  For a moment, she hesitates.  But the pandemonium leaves her little choice. She SLICES into the Mimic's corpse with the razor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? ...sticks her arm in all the way to the elbow... ...and pulls out two fat AMBER SACS the size of softballs.  She SLICES them open. Orange GOO leaks out, its stench overpowering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (covers his nose)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit! Peter looks up as Susan slides one of the sacs over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rub it on the windows!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it!! Holding his breath, against the stench, he smears the crap on the windows, the doorframe...

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: looks to the roof, listening. And remarkably, the SOUNDS of the Mimics START SUBSIDING. Susan comes over to Leonard, begins dabbing the goop on Leonard's wound.  Leonard makes a face at the stink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you putting that crap on me for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scent glands.  Insects use 'em to identify themselves to each other. She smears the floor area behind Leonard. The activity wi down gradually, and finally comes almost to a halt.

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: Leaning against the dirtied window, Manny creates a strea for every Mimic he sees. Peter, Leonard and Susan are hard at work. Leonard has created a small "model" of the station using pocket debri and the wall map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. That's us. Manny's lighter represents the subway car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This track we're on? Goes down into the repair area. (Makes an "X" further down)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator's over here. Leads up to the active tunnels. THUMP! An oily, soft abdomen brushes lazily up against the glass. Manny moves away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we get this car there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone'd have to go to the switchroom, pull the coupling lever, that'll send us left and to the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the power...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I might be able to juice the whole area, if I can get to the power box. It's just a couple of cables...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, how you gonna get there, Leonard? Hop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Leonard)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just talk me through it. I can go with Manny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would take a minute or so. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You won't last that long out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, you couldn't even fix our TV! Tense silence. He points at the glands on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll cover ourselves with this. They can mimic us-  we Goddam mimic them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It worked before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (an edge in her voice)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scent won't last...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why we should do it now. Susan knows they have no other choice.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Susan is stuffing Leonard's old bloody bandages into the thorax of the dead Mimic.  She ties a flare to its center

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just a regular old pump switch, okay? Right by the track signal board. Manny is spreading the mucus-like liquid of the gland-sac himself and Peter as Leonard instructs them-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights come up, you pull the switch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I pull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't do that, we're on the wrong track. (turns to Peter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You... The two men look into each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna finally get to fuck around with the wires.  Think you can handle it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends.  You got a memo? Leonard's hard feelings give way to an almost imperceptible smile. Using a ballpoint pen, he draws a schematic on the back of Peter's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right then.  You gonna find two wires.  One's green.  The other's blue...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: approaches Manny, who looks distractedly out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out there. I heard him. How can he be? This things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't protect him, lady. He trusted me. And I didn't protect him... His father...I lost his father to the streets and now, Chuy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll find him. We'll be back and find him. Manny doesn't respond.

dialogues.speaker: READY TO GO
dialogues.text: Susan dabs at Peter's face with the last touches of the scent gland substance.  She doesn't meet his eyes as she speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to keep it really slow.  Their eyes react to sudden movements. Peter barely nods, his nerves clearly on edge.  He instinctively goes to wipe his forehead.  Susan stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch it.  And for Godsakes, try not to sweat.  They can sense chemical changes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try not to sweat? Leonard turns to Susan and Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, people... Leonard's voice comes through like a clarion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...are we ready for this? Susan has her hand on Peter's chest; Peter is taking deep breaths, trying to cool down his body to prevent sweat. an odd parody of Lamaze exercise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever you do, don't step on the third rail coming back. Six hundred volts'll blow your leg right off. A final breath.  He's about as calm as he's going to get. He looks at Susan a long moment. He takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just thinking how I could use a pair of pliers... and I remembered where they are...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (overlapping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. That's it. Breathe easy. A sad, nervous smile appears on Peter's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the tool box under the kitchen counter... Susan kisses him softly on the lips. Manny approaches.  Show time. Susan steps away from Peter. She looks toward the control booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it.

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: begins turning the lever crank slowly.

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY DOORS
dialogues.text: gradually begin to open, and stop half way. The darkness outside is alive with CLICKING.

dialogues.speaker: PETER AND MANNY
dialogues.text: slowly move between the opening of the door and make thei way to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They step onto the dusty concrete.  Come to a stop.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: watches nervously for the reaction of the Mimics

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: LARGE SHADOWS pass far and near of Peter and Manny; but n of the Mimics seem to care about them one way or the othe Peter and Manny exchange looks: a moment of relief.  It's working. Peter slowly moves right along the track to the nearby PO BOX. Manny goes left, starts to make a longer journey across t platform to the SWITCH ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: Susan moves away from the door, goes over the Mimic carca filled with the bloody bandages.

dialogues.speaker: PLATFORM
dialogues.text: Peter makes his way to the edge of the platform, whisperi to himself. He lowers himself slowly to the track.

dialogues.speaker: PLATFORM
dialogues.text: Manny moves toward the door.  A large WINDOW OF DUSTY GLA reflects his image...and the distant ones of the Mimics.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE TRACKS
dialogues.text: Peter gets to the track.  He turns And is met FACE TO FACE WITH A MIMIC! Its antennae move toward his head, curious. Its human-mask face plate clicks apart and together. Peter remains stock still.  He starts breathing deeply...

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: Leonard has now fully opened the doors.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: pulls the tipcase of the FLARE tied to the dead Mimic's midsection.  FSST!  The flare SPARKS alive. The sudden light draws the attention of several Mimics outside. Susan pushes the carcass toward an open door at the front the car... ...and with a HEAVE, throws it onto the front track.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: The other Mimics take instant notice.

dialogues.speaker: BY PETER
dialogues.text: The Mimic before him suddenly turns.  In a flash of speed it's gone, heading toward

dialogues.speaker: THE DEAD MIMIC
dialogues.text: stuffed with the bloody rage, the thing sends its fellow into a feeding frenzy. The other Mimics begin TEARING into it, ripping their bro to shreds in cannibalistic orgy.

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: Susan watches in disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choke on it, motherfuckers. Leonard turns the lever crank again.  The doors begin to shut.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: breathes a sigh of relief. He goes to the powerbox, opens it up. He shines his flashlight down on the back of his hand. The simple chart tells him what to wire:  BLUE WIRES TO THE GREEN WIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green...Blue... He looks back up at the powerbox.  His face falls. All the wires are a GROSS BROWN, their colored plastic casings having long ago faded into goo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny enters. The space is even more dusty than the rest the station. Spiderwebs strung over old machinery.  White Doric PILLARS support the ceiling like skeletal bones.  1 style LAMPS are built into their side. Manny looks around.  Off to the right, right next to the rusted track switch board, he heads for the COUPLING SWIT Once there, he rests and, through the murky windows, he waves back to LEONARD. He pulls out his pills box and takes a pill. But his hand are shaking, under enormous tension. Some of the pills scatter on the floor. He puts the box away and leans against the wall. A CLICKING nearby catches his attention, echoing from the entrance of ANOTHER ROOM. It is not the sound of the Mimics; but rather, of METAL. Spoons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuy...? Manny follows the sound.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE TRACK
dialogues.text: Peter desperately tries to connect the wires the right wa He wipes off the brown gunk, tries to discern any semblan of color. He feels himself start to sweat.  He tries to relax. Breathes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The space is larger than the switchroom.  The walls and ceiling have an odd, shiny consistency. Manny heads in further, locates the levers and waits. Something pale and small emerges from the dark, a few fee away, a face that seems to float in the eerie half-light. A RUSTLING behind him.  Manny turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino... He swings the light onto Chuy, sitting on the floor befor the remains of a RUSTY COLUMN.  That beautiful, emotionle smile on his pale face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuy...

dialogues.speaker: BY THE POWERBOX
dialogues.text: Peter has made all the necessary connections.  He turns n to the fuse-section. A red throw-switch is there, and two big slots for fuses. One is still occupied. The other one empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit!

dialogues.speaker: CU
dialogues.text: BEADS OF SWEAT begin to form.

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: Susan watches the Mimics at their feast. All of a sudden, they begin to stop, as if losing interes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scent's fading... Susan steps back, looks around desperately for a flashlig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tense as hell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Manny doing? I can't see him anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nino, please... Manny slaps his knees with both hands in a parental gestu of "come to me". In the darkness, something that looks like a PALM FROND floats gracefully down from the ceiling, making see-saw gestures as it falls through the air. Manny shines his flashlight on the floor.  It's not a pal frond. It's a wing. Manny turns his flashlight to the ceiling and walls. The place IS COVERED WITH MIMICS.  They are in the middle a vicious mating ritual.  The males tear savagely at the females wings as they proceed to mount them.  A chaotic clusterfuck. Manny is sickened. CHUY GIGGLES. Manny shines his light ahead. Manny's face falls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dios mio... The WHITE PILLAR BEHIND CHUY IS MOVING... ...unfolding... ...at last revealing... AN ALBINO MIMIC!  Another leap for evolution... Its form is different from the other Mimics.  Sleeker, mo supple, almost beautiful.  And while its movements are st not completely human, there is a kind of unearthly grace them that at the very least entrance us. The thing raises itself to full height, dwarfing the tiny boy.  It stands over him like a king over his court fool. Chuy giggles happily.  It's all a game to him. The Albino CLICKS in response -- a long, leisurely sound, if trying to communicate with the boy. Chuy pulls his spoons out and begins to play them, making perfect imitation of the sound. Manny starts to tremble as the creature gazes upon him wi huge, expressionless 'eyes'.  He turns to Chuy-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chuy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends. The Albino CLICKS his jaws, moving in toward Manny.

dialogues.speaker: CHUY
dialogues.text: plays his SPOONS in perfect imitation.

dialogues.speaker: MANNY
dialogues.text: stands under an archway in a swirl of dust. He raises his arms, like a prophet. He lets go of hsi razor and kneels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God has closed his eyes. This, he cannot see... His vacant eyes, fill with tears, he prays quietly, a str serenity invades him. The Albino's jaws open and charge.

dialogues.speaker: PLATFORM
dialogues.text: Some Mimics advance toward Peter's direction.

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: Susan desperately waves a flashlight and bangs the window trying to attract their attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over here! Over here! Goddam you!!

dialogues.speaker: BY THE TRACKS
dialogues.text: Peter BREAKS the arm off one of his glasses.  He jams it the empty fuse.  It SPARKS.

dialogues.speaker: PLATFORM
dialogues.text: THUMP!  The electricity COMES ON... The lamps on the columns BURST INTO FLAMES from the power surge.  Fire illuminates the station like a Greek temple.

dialogues.speaker: BY THE TRACKS
dialogues.text: Peter climbs up onto the tracks... ...sweat staining his forehead... Peter wipes it and removes the scent coating.

dialogues.speaker: THE MIMICS
dialogues.text: clearly react, sensing the chemical change, like bees reacting to honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Leonard)

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: looks at the now lit control panels, tries to decide whic button to press. He begins to press each one in turn.

dialogues.speaker: PETER
dialogues.text: hears the sound of spoons playing. He turns to see Chuy, standing by the outside of the swit room.  The boy smiles. A flashlight shines behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny... But the thing holding the flashlight is anything but huma The ALBINO steps into view, moving eerily like an unstrun puppet. His claws and jaws are coated in blood. Chuy joyf announces the arrival like a little drummer boy.

dialogues.speaker: THE MIMICS
dialogues.text: climb over the roof, moving toward the rear of the-

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: Susan runs in.  SLAMS her hand down on a button.

dialogues.speaker: THE SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: The doors open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter!! Peter hesitates, takes a step toward Chuy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, kid... Chuy seeks shelter behind the Albino's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (horrified)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus! The albino charges toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run!! Peter!! Peter bolts for the car.

dialogues.speaker: THE MIMICS
dialogues.text: jump and land

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: just as Peter squeezes through one of the doors. BAM! THUD! The doors dent. Glass cracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Yelling to Leonard)

dialogues.speaker: GO
dialogues.text: Susan presses the button. The doors close again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kid's with them!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you-?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!! Just go!!

dialogues.speaker: CONTROL BOOTH
dialogues.text: Leonard throws the dead man's switch by the control board

dialogues.speaker: SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: JOLTS into action.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE
dialogues.text: The train LURCHES forward. Wheels spark and kick into gear. The mimics scramble and assemble quickly, ready to attack.

dialogues.speaker: THE ALBINO
dialogues.text: changes position and charges towards the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: reaches a "Y" section.  The car moves to the track to the right.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: Leonard's eyes go wide as he sees

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manny never threw the coupling switch!! We're goin' the wrong way!!!

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE CAR
dialogues.text: It keeps bearing right. Further away from their destinati ...towards an old STORAGE YARD in their path.  Idle cars repair equipment on the tracks. A crash seems inevitable.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: Leonard pulls

dialogues.speaker: THE BRAKES
dialogues.text: but they don't work at all. From below the car we see the wheels spinning freely, heading for collision.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CAR
dialogues.text: Susan grabs Leonard from the control booth. To Peter

dialogues.speaker: MOVE BACK
dialogues.text: They rush back against the opposite door.

dialogues.speaker: STORAGE YARD
dialogues.text: CRAAASHH!!  The car BASHES into a parked section of train a GRIN of tearing metal... ...flips off the track... ...and onto its side... The car skids to a stop.  SPARKS fill the air.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: All three are hurt.  Leonard's leg wound has reopened. Pe has badly damaged his right arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You all right? Peter nods painfully.  Susan to Leonard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Simply, re: his leg)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't feel it. Peter and Susan sling Leonard's arms over their shoulders They raise him up.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE SUBWAY CAR
dialogues.text: They move unsteadily outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across both tracks!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit. They head off over a concrete island in the direction of correct track.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER BACK
dialogues.text: The Mimics and the Albino moving closer.

dialogues.speaker: PETER AND SUSAN
dialogues.text: try to hurry, but it's no use given Leonard's condition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme go. Peter and Susan both disregard the order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're no leaving you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way we can outrun 'em together. Move it! Leonard suddenly grabs his POLICE BATON from his belt clip.  He pushes the two away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOW!! GO!! Get the hell off my beat! Leonard turns away from them. Peter goes to get Leonard, but Susan stops him.  This MTA officer is staying put.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.  Come to poppa. Reluctantly, the two begin down the tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: LEONARD
dialogues.text: takes a stand by the third rail, baton in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Susan run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There. An open CAGE ELEVATOR on a platform nearby.  A sign overh AUTHORIZED PERSONNEL ONLY. They rush toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leonard stands like a guardian to the tunnel mouth. SOUNDS of the Mimics approaching. He glances at the third rail beside him, then down the track.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, you mealy-mouthed... The sound gets louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Multi-legged... Leonard raises his baton in top MTA form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maggot-munchin' motherfu... THUD!  Several Mimcs slam onto Leonard! Leonard goes down, HITTING them futilely with his baton. They begin to tear at his limbs. Leonard rolls... ...kicks his good leg out... ...and CONNECTS WITH THE THIRD RAIL. AN ARC of ELECTRICITY lights up the darkness, consuming Leonard and the Mimics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crackling sound echoes through to Peter and Susan. Susan hits the elevator button again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't tell if it's working! Peter has unbarred the gate.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: looks up, into the shaft.

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR
dialogues.text: coming down, but it's taking its own sweet time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, come on, come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jump in. Peter pulls her into the shaft, closes the security gate behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A skeletal framework on each side.  Just enough for a handhold. Peter steadies Susan as she climbs in beside him.  She balances on the narrow ledge. Peter SLAMS the cage door shut, latching it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go first. I'll be right below you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your arm, you can't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can.  We can do this... He shows her the first hand and foothold.  Susan grabs on

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Albino amkes its way forward, flanked by two Mimics. It stops. Turns toward the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan hauls herself up the framework, handhold by handhold. Peter is right below her. She can see his arms are starting to tremble dangerously with the effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna make it! Peter grinds his teeth, trying to make the next handhold. WHAM!  Something hits the gate below them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mimics are tearing at the metal gate. The Albino remains still, watching them work.

dialogues.speaker: PETER AND SUSAN
dialogues.text: Susan's arm and legs are shaking now.  Her breath starts catching in her throat with the effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hold your breath!  Keep it going, even flow! Susan tried, but can't.  She tries to pull herself up to next level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter... Susan pulls herself up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really glad I'm not pregnant.

dialogues.speaker: REVERSE
dialogues.text: We look down past them as they climb.  Two of the Mimics the Albino have gotten into the shaft! The Albino is so long it climbs by bracing its legs again opposite walls.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN AND PETER
dialogues.text: Susan is crying, barely any strength left. Peter does his best to stay in control, but in truth is barely hanging on himself. LIGHT hits them from the shaft above now, SOUNDS of PEOPL TALKING and a muffled P.A. ANNOUNCEMENT filter down.

dialogues.speaker: MIMICS
dialogues.text: rushing upward on the shaft wall, higher, higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's hands grab onto the grating of the gate on the ne floor. KCHUNK! is heard above them.  Peter looks up. Now the elevator is coming down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang onto me. Peter pulls Susan up till she can grab it too, both of th able to get a foothold on the ledge-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on tight! He begins to KICK on the gate, trying to tear it free.  S looks back down.

dialogues.speaker: SHAFT
dialogues.text: The Mimics rush up, closer, closer.  The Albino opens its mandibles.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN AND PETER
dialogues.text: both KICK at the gate, it gives, Peter pulls Susan throug to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on! Peter and Susan stumble away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Albino sees the elevator approaching from above. It gives a few CLICKS to its minions. The two other Mimics race up the shaft... ...toward the elevator... ...and WEDGE THEMSELVES IN ON EITHER SIDE! They are CRUSHED instantly.  But the elevator is stopped above the open gate. With just enough room for the Albino to get through to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan and Peter run.  There is LIGHT just up the tunnel. hear VOICES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look back! They go for it.  At last, they make it to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan and Peter stumble forward.  Light streams down from overheads. Susan turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Albino spills out onto the track behind them. Sleek, streamlined, light glancing beautifully off it.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN AND PETER
dialogues.text: turn back... HEADLIGHTS hit them as we hear the ROAR of a SUBWAY TRAIN heading at them from the other side of the platform!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do it! They run.

dialogues.speaker: ALBINO
dialogues.text: runs, faster than any other Mimic.

dialogues.speaker: TRAIN
dialogues.text: The express train BLOWS its HORN, RUSHING FORWARD.

dialogues.speaker: PLATFORM
dialogues.text: Weary late-night COMMUTERS stand half-asleep on the track A sleepy-eyed little girl points, tugging on her mother's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy, there's people...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Adrenaline pumping)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We-can-do-this!!!

dialogues.speaker: MOTORMAN
dialogues.text: The driver sees the battered couple... He reaches for the brake...

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN AND PETER
dialogues.text: They reach the edge of the platform, the HORN deafening a the train speeds toward them.  Peter pushes Susan up, lea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We RUSH toward his horrified face.

dialogues.speaker: THE ALBINO
dialogues.text: directly ahead. The train, still flying, PLOWS INTO IT... ...flattening, grinding, pulverizing... ...until the windshield of the subway car is covered in w blood. The motoran leans on the brake, his eyes screwed shut in primal horror. The train SQUEALS to a stop...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE PLATFORM
dialogues.text: Susan and Peter collapse on the cement floor in each othe arms.  Heaving and weeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: COMMUTERS turn to stare as Peter and Susan move across the floor.  Both bruised and bloodied, leaning against each other, heading for the exit. Some DERELICTS observe them with curiosity. A trio of MTA cops start towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be fine... it... They're still down there. We'll seal the whole system, go in with whatever it takes... But Peter's voice evidences a lack of conviction now, he's trying to convince both Susan and himself of something he doesn't fully believe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be fine... We nailed them before, we'll do it again... He hurries to meet the MTA cops. Susan looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Commuters move to and fro, moving up and down and in and out of the illuminated areas of the station. In the crush of onlookers is one deadpan face-  a MIMIC, hugging the shadows, waiting for its moment! We PAN 180 degrees to the other side of the platform- there, briefly glimpsed is ANOTHER, and ANOTHER. We TILT down to the throng below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (barely audible)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've come up... The electrified VOICE of the train ANNOUNCER suddenly FADES UP, telling of departures and delays- We raise above Susan's head-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The 11:16 local to Poughkeepsie, boarding now, Track 32- the 7:20 Connecticut local, making connections to South Norwalk-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -culminating in an OVERHEAD VIEW of the main terminal. The movement continues. But from here, the people are dots, their importanec no greater than that of a colony of ants.
